alert.note: Alert for Tulare (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued March 11 at 1:57PM PST until March 11 at 5:00PM PST by NWS Hanford
info.description: The National Weather Service in Hanford has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... South Central Tulare County in central California... * Until 500 PM PST. * At 157 PM PST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Camp Nelson, Peppermint, Quaking Aspen, Ponderosa, Johnsondale and Springville. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
